landing.description: Passionate Front End Developer eager to expand skills and embrace new challenges.

about.title: About me
about.name: I'm
about.parraf: I have a background in science with experience as a Clinical Laboratory Technician in Spain. Shortly after I moved to the Netherlands, where I worked in After-Sales Service and IT program Translator. During this period, I had my first contact with programming. Since then, my interest in training in this field has grown rapidly. I am currently in Ireland where I worked as a Customer Success at a SaaS company which provided me with the key to enroll in an intensive Adalab course to become a Web Developer.
about.parraf2: Today I feel motivated to continue learning in the technology industry and grow professionally in a company that gives me an opportunity.

projects.title: Projects
projects.subtitle: Here are a few projects I've worked on recently.
projects.cashFlowDescription: This is a personal project, where I wanted to put Vue.js into practice. The biggest challenge was using traditional HTML as templates that Vue uses, it was like learning another way of approaching a problem.
projects.memoryGameDescription: This is a personal project, responding to my son's request I have created a teaching game to practice JavaScript by applying sounds. The challenge I had was to reset the cards that I solved with a for function.
projects.harryPotterDescription: This is a bootcamp evaluation project at Adalab where I had to apply what I learned about React and using APIs. The challenge I faced was understanding lifting state up and the connection between the parent and the children, and how they passed information to each other. It's quite simple: from child to child, they cannot directly exchange information; you have to inform the parent first and then let the parent decide whether to share that information with the other child. That's what lifting state up is all about.
projects.awsomeCardsDescription: This is a real bootcamp team project where I applied JavaScript and CSS/SASS in practice while working under an Agile and Scrum system. The biggest challenge I encountered was resolving conflicts during commits to the master branch. However, this challenge was overcome through fluid team communication.
projects.guessNumberDescription: This project was one of the initial bootcamp assessments involving JavaScript and CSS. The most significant challenge was completing it within a single morning, with just one week of learning JavaScript. Thanks to Stack Overflow and a solid understanding of the fundamental concepts needed for its application, my game worked!
